oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena

Class OracleGraphBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase
      • oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.OracleGraphBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.jena.graph.Graph, org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphWithPerform
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GraphOracleSem, OracleNamedGraph

    public abstract class OracleGraphBase
extends org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase
implements org.apache.jena.graph.Graph
    An internal common graph parent class. This class contains a common set of method implementations shared by subclasses including GraphOracleSem and OracleNamedGraph.
    Since:
    Nov. 2011

      Gives the underlying JDBC driver a hint as to the number of rows that should be fetched from the database when more rows are needed for query answering.
      void setQueryInferenceGraphOnly(boolean b)
      This function will add INF_ONLY=T option to the underlying query when b is set to true.
      void setSpoOptFlag(boolean b)
      This method turns on an optimization, if b is true, for a graphBaseFind based query that returns all rows matching (?s ?p ?o)
      void setSubjectOptFlag(boolean b)
      This method turns on an optimization, if b is true, for a graphBaseFind based query when only the subject in the Triple parameter is specified.
      void setUseSessionParams(boolean b)
      There are two Oracle session parameters that may help inference performance.
      void useVirtualModel()
      Creates a virtual model, or reuses the existing one if available, to answer queries instead of a union all of all models and entailments specified in the attachment.
      void useVirtualModel(java.lang.String vmName)
      Uses a virtual model to answer queries instead of a union all of all models and entailments specified in the attachment.

    • Method Detail

      • clearRepository

        public abstract void clearRepository()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method removes all data belonging to this OracleGraphBase object
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • close

        public void close()
        Flushes any pending JDBC statements, commits transaction, and closes this graph instance. Note that the underlying database connection remains open.

        If this graph is referenced elsewhere, then the graph may not close. All users of the same graph instance must close the graph before it can actually close.

        Whether this graph is referenced elsewhere or not, this method will commit the transaction if this graph is not already closed.

        Specified by:
        close in interface org.apache.jena.graph.Graph
        Overrides:
        close in class org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase

      • closeWithoutCommit

        public void closeWithoutCommit()
        This method closes this OracleGraphBase object without committing the underlying transaction. In addition, it flushes any pending JDBC statements.

        This method has no effect if this model base is already closed.

        Note that the underlying database connection is not committed and it remains open. Inference, if applicable, will not be updated.

      • commitTransaction

        public void commitTransaction()
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Flushes the underlying JDBC statements and persists changes. Other database sessions can see the changes after this method call.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • commitTransaction

        public void commitTransaction(boolean tryInf)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Persists changes. Other database sessions can see the changes after this method call.
        Parameters:
        tryInf - if true, will update rules index (entailment) by invoking performInference when there is an Attachment object specified.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteInference

        public void deleteInference()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops the rules index/entailment. Note that transaction will be committed before any logic is carried out.

        Call rollbackTransaction() if there are any changes that should not be persisted.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error generated from the underlying PL/SQL call.

      • dropApplicationTableIndex

        public void dropApplicationTableIndex()
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Drops the application table index. Note that there is a DDL operation behind the scenes, so your transaction will be committed. This method can be called before a bulk load is invoked, as an optimization.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error with the underlying DDL.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
              throws java.lang.Throwable
        Cleans up resources, such as closing the model.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable

      • flushAdd

        public void flushAdd()
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes existing batched JDBC statements for inserting triples/quads. This method call will make sure queries using the same database connection are able to see the triples/quads added through performAdd. However, it should not be confused with a database commit, because other database sessions will not see the changes done in this session. For that to happen, you must invoke commitTransaction.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for DMLs.

      • flushDelete

        public void flushDelete()
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes existing batched JDBC statements for removing triples/quads. This method call will make sure queries using the same database connection are able to see the triples/quads removed through performDelete(Triple). However, it should not be confused with a database commit, because other database sessions will not see the changes done in this session. For that to happen, you must invoke commitTransaction().
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error for DMLs.

        public long getCount(org.apache.jena.graph.Triple m)

      • getDOP

        public int getDOP()
        This method returns the degree of parallelism for underlying SQL operations. Note that the DOP setting has an upper bound controlled by the JVM parameter oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.maxDOP.

      • getQueryInferenceGraphOnly

        public boolean getQueryInferenceGraphOnly()
        Returns the setting (true/false) on query inference graph.

      • getSize

        public long getSize()
        Returns the number of unique triples/quads contained in this graph object. The size reported here does not include those triples/quads contained via attachment. This method is more efficient than GraphBase.size() because only one SQL statement of select count(*) is issued to retrieve a row count.

        Note that this method does not work in readonly case.

      • getSpoOptFlag

        public boolean getSpoOptFlag()
        Returns the value last set by setSpoOptFlag.
        Returns:
        true if SPO optimization is used.

      • getStatusForEntailedGraph

        public int getStatusForEntailedGraph()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the status of the inferred graph (entailment). The status can only be one of the following: GraphOracleSem.VALID_ENTAILMENT, GraphOracleSem.INCOMPLETE_ENTAILMENT, GraphOracleSem.INVALID_ENTAILMENT, GraphOracleSem.NO_SUCH_ENTAILMENT, or GraphOracleSem.NO_RULEBASE.
        Returns:
        status of the inferred graph
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • graphBaseFindSubjectObject

        public org.apache.jena.util.iterator.ExtendedIterator graphBaseFindSubjectObject(org.apache.jena.graph.Node[] predicates,
                                                                                 org.apache.jena.sparql.engine.ExecutionContext ctxt)
        This method returns an object of type ExtendedIterator that contains answers to the query. Answers consist of triples/quads that have predicates specified in the Node object array.
        Parameters:
        predicates - an array of Nodes for all possible predicates. It must be an array of URIs.
        Throws:
        org.apache.jena.shared.JenaException - when there is any SQLException generated from the underlying SQL execution.

      • hasVirtualModel

        public boolean hasVirtualModel()
        This method returns TRUE if the name of virtual model is not null.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Returns whether this graph is closed. It is not recommended to continue use a closed graph.

        If this graph is cached, then this method will only return true if all references to this cached graph have called close() or closeWithoutCommit().

        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface org.apache.jena.graph.Graph
        Overrides:
        isClosed in class org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase
        Returns:
        true if this graph is already closed, false otherwise
        See Also:
        close(), closeWithoutCommit(), isCached()

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns TRUE if this OracleGraphBase object is readonly (created based on a virtual model).

      • performAdd

        public void performAdd(org.apache.jena.graph.Triple t)
        Adds a triple into the graph. This change to this graph object will not be persisted until the transaction is committed. However, subsequent queries (using the same Oracle connection) can see this change.

        If a SQLException happens during the operation, the underlying transaction will be rolled back to a consistent state.

        Specified by:
        performAdd in interface org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphWithPerform
        Overrides:
        performAdd in class org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase
        Parameters:
        t - triple to be added
        Throws:
        org.apache.jena.shared.JenaException - if the triple passed in is not a valid RDF triple.

      • performDelete

        public void performDelete(org.apache.jena.graph.Triple t)
        Deletes a triple t from this graph. Changes made to the graph are not persisted until transaction is committed. However, subsequent queries using the same Oracle connection can see this change.

        If there is SQLException happening during the operation, the underlying transaction will be rolled back for a consistent state.

        Specified by:
        performDelete in interface org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphWithPerform
        Overrides:
        performDelete in class org.apache.jena.graph.impl.GraphBase
        Parameters:
        t - the triple to be removed from the graph
        Throws:
        org.apache.jena.shared.JenaException - if the triple passed in is not a valid RDF triple.

      • performInference

        public void performInference()
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a rules index/entailment based on the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model and any other attached models and rulebases via Attachment.

        Note that the transaction will be committed before any inference is carried out.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error during native inferencing.

      • performInference

        public void performInference(java.lang.String components)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a rules index/entailment based on the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model and any other attached models and rulebases via Attachment.

        Note that the transaction will be committed before any inference is carried out. Call rollbackTransaction() if there are any changes that should not be persisted.

        Parameters:
        components - specifies the INF_COMPONENTS_IN parameter in the SEM_APIS.CREATE_ENTAILMENT PL/SQL interface. It is only applicable to Oracle 11g and it can be NULL. When not null, it provides the ability for selective inferencing. See the following document for details: Oracle Database Semantic Technologies Developer's Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is server side error.

      • performInference

        public void performInference(java.lang.String components,
                             java.lang.String deltaModel)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a rules index/entailment based on the underlying RDF/OWL/SKOS model and any other attached models and rulebases via Attachment.

        Note that the transaction will be committed before any inference is carried out. Call rollbackTransaction() if there are any changes that should not be persisted.

        Parameters:
        components - specifies the INF_COMPONENTS_IN parameter in the SEM_APIS.CREATE_ENTAILMENT PL/SQL interface. It is only applicable to Oracle 11g and it can be NULL. When not null, it provides the ability for selective inferencing. See the following document for details: Oracle Database Semantic Technologies Developer's Guide 11g Release 1 (11.1)
        deltaModel - the name of the model that stores additional triples/quads for incremental inference. Please refer to the delta_in parameter of SEM_APIS.create_entailment API in the Oracle Database Semantic Technologies Developer's Guide. It can be NULL.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is server side error.

      • populateCache

        public void populateCache()
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method populates mid-tier cache with all the data from this graph instance.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • rebuildApplicationTableIndex

        public void rebuildApplicationTableIndex()
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Rebuilds the application table index. Note that there is a DDL operation behind the scenes, so the existing transaction will be committed.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error with the underlying DDL.

      • rebuildApplicationTableIndex

        public void rebuildApplicationTableIndex(int dop)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Rebuilds the application table index. Note that there is a DDL operation behind the scenes, so the existing transaction will be committed.
        Parameters:
        dop - - degree of parallelism.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error with the underlying DDL.

               throws java.sql.SQLException

        java.sql.SQLException

                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Inquires and returns the internal ID assigned for the underlying Oracle RDF/OWL/SKOS model of this graph object.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is error happening to the underlying SQL execution.

      • rollbackTransaction

        public void rollbackTransaction()
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Rollback changes done to the graph.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • setDOP

        public void setDOP(int i)
        This method sets of degree of parallelism for underlying SQL operations.

      • setImplicitBulkLoadFlags

        public void setImplicitBulkLoadFlags(java.lang.String flags)
        This method sets the flags (options) to be used when bulk loader is chosen implicitly to load a graph. The flags set here will not affect the completeBulk API.

      • setImplicitBulkLoadListener

        public void setImplicitBulkLoadListener(StatusListener sl)
        This method sets the StatusListener object to be used when bulk loader is chosen implicitly to load a graph. The StatusListener object set here will not affect the completeBulk API.

      • setInferenceOption

        public void setInferenceOption(java.lang.String inferenceOption)
        Set the inference option used by performInference (create_entailment).
        Parameters:
        inferenceOption - the inference option to be used by future performInference calls. One can enable parallel, incremental inference, and/or set using RAW datatype through this API.

      • setObjectOptFlag

        public void setObjectOptFlag(boolean b)
        This method turns on an optimization, if b is true, for a graphBaseFind based query when only the object in the Triple parameter is specified.
        Parameters:
        b - true to turn the optimization on.

      • setQueryFetchSize

        public void setQueryFetchSize(int size)
        Gives the underlying JDBC driver a hint as to the number of rows that should be fetched from the database when more rows are needed for query answering.
        Parameters:
        size - the number of rows that should be fetched from a result set

      • setQueryInferenceGraphOnly

        public void setQueryInferenceGraphOnly(boolean b)
        This function will add INF_ONLY=T option to the underlying query when b is set to true.
        Parameters:
        b - allows query to run against just the inferred graph when set to true. It is only applicable when there is a rulebase attached.

      • setSpoOptFlag

        public void setSpoOptFlag(boolean b)
        This method turns on an optimization, if b is true, for a graphBaseFind based query that returns all rows matching (?s ?p ?o)
        Parameters:
        b - true to turn the optimization on.

      • setSubjectOptFlag

        public void setSubjectOptFlag(boolean b)
        This method turns on an optimization, if b is true, for a graphBaseFind based query when only the subject in the Triple parameter is specified.
        Parameters:
        b - true to turn the optimization on.

      • setUseSessionParams

        public void setUseSessionParams(boolean b)
        There are two Oracle session parameters that may help inference performance.
        Parameters:
        b - specifies whether some Oracle specific sessions parameters are used or not

      • useVirtualModel

        public void useVirtualModel()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a virtual model, or reuses the existing one if available, to answer queries instead of a union all of all models and entailments specified in the attachment.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of server failure.

      • useVirtualModel

        public void useVirtualModel(java.lang.String vmName)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Uses a virtual model to answer queries instead of a union all of all models and entailments specified in the attachment.
        Parameters:
        vmName - - if given, the GraphOracleSem instance will use the virtual model named vmName. If null, then a new virtual model will be created (unless a VM with the same models/rulebase combination as the attachment exists).
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - in case of server failure.
